document.heading: ATTORNEY GENERAL FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA CLARIFICATION AND ELECTED TERM AMENDMENT ACT OF 2009

history.narrative: Law 18-160, the “Attorney General for the District of Columbia Clarification and Elected Term Amendment Act of 2010”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-65, which was referred to the Committee on Public Safety and the Judiciary. The bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 5, 2010, and February 2, 2010, respectively. Deemed approved without the signature of the Mayor on March 30, 2010, it was assigned Act No. 18-351 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-160 became effective on May 27, 2010.
